Description:
Receive incoming mail, sorts, and logs and distributes as required.
Receives outgoing mail, logs and distributes.
Type forms, reports, letters and memoranda as required.
Receive telephone calls and visitors. Provide answers to routine questions or takes messages. Refers other matters to appropriate personnel.
Create and maintain filing systems, records, and indices. Keeps reference files and policy manuals up-to-date by adding and deleting obsolete information.
Maintain office supplies as necessary.
Operate reproduction machines, fax machines, microfilm equipment and other office machines as required.
Verify attendance, hours worked, compile employee time and post information in time sheets and designated records.
Keep track of leave time, such as vacation, personal, and sick leave for employees.
Perform any other clerical or miscellaneous duties as requested by the supervisor.Skills
Skills:
Even freshers can apply for this position.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptability
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel)
